intro: Horkelia sericea, commonly known as silverleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. Horkelia sericea is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
